thread.title: Person hit by Orange Line train at Haymarket - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Person hit by Orange Line train at Haymarket - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Person hit by Orange Line train at Haymarket - Massachusetts news
text:
A person was struck by an Orange Line train at Haymarket Station in Boston at about 9:15 p.m. Wednesday, according to Boston fire.
Tech rescue response to the Haymarket MBTA station for a person under an Orange line train at 9:15pm.
— Boston Fire Dept. (@BostonFire) October 22, 2015 Person is conscious. Firefighters have removed person. Person now being treated and transported by @BOSTON_EMS to hospital
— Boston Fire Dept. (@BostonFire) October 22, 2015 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Fire companies starting to clear scene. Transit Police to investigate.
— Boston Fire Dept. (@BostonFire) October 22, 2015 Orange Line service had been suspended between North Station and Back Bay Station, according to the MBTA , and buses had replaced Orange Line trains between North Station and Oak Grove Station. However, regular service resumed at 10:30 p.m.
